===Etymology===
{{IPAchar|/ɕadau/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɕadɔː/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɕadoː/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しゃどう}} compound {{m|zh|車道|tr=tsyhæ daw<sup>X</sup>|lit=carriage + way}}.  Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} {{zh-l|車道|tr=''ce<sup>1</sup> dou<sup>6</sup>''|traffic lane}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|しゃどう|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|しゃどう|hhira=しやだう}}

# a [[road]], a [[roadway]], a [[carriageway]]
# {{qualifier|more specifically|legal}} a [[traffic]] [[lane]]: that portion of a [[road]] that is marked for use by [[automobile]]s {{qualifier|and not for bicycles or pedestrians}}

====Usage notes====
The ''traffic lane'' sense is the main sense in [[legal]] contexts, as defined by the {{m|ja|道路交通法|tr=Tsūro Kōtsū Hō||Road Traffic Act}}.

* {{ja-r|自転車道|じてんしゃどう}}: a [[bicycle lane]]
* {{ja-r|歩道|ほどう}}: a [[sidewalk]], a [[pedestrian]] [[walkway]]
